content:
# EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Station at (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (41.0, -82.0)
- Wooden chest (41.5, -80.5) for coal storage
- Burner inserter (41.5, -79.5) moving items from mining drill to chest

### Iron Production Line at (-18.0, -53.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (-18.0, -53.0) for iron ore
- Wooden chest (-17.5, -51.5) for temporary iron ore storage
- Burner inserter (-16.5, -51.5) moving ore from chest to furnace
- Stone furnace (-15.0, -51.0) smelting iron ore
- Burner inserter (-13.5, -50.5) moving plates to storage
- Wooden chest (-12.5, -50.5) for iron plate storage

### Belt Network
An extensive belt network consisting of multiple interconnected groups:
- Upper section (-15.5 to -13.5, -52.5)
- Middle section (-9.5 to -4.5, various y coordinates)
- Lower vertical section (-2.5 to 2.5, -30.5 to -2.5)
- Multiple horizontal connectors at various y-levels
- Extended vertical transport system reaching from y=-53.5 to y=-2.5

# ERROR TIPS

### Storage Management
- Monitor chest capacities to prevent overflow conditions
- Empty storage chests regularly when "chest is full" warnings appear
- Implement overflow protection mechanisms for critical storage points

### Fuel Management
- Keep all burner devices (mining drills, inserters) adequately fueled
- Monitor fuel levels regularly to maintain continuous operation
- Ensure coal production and distribution keeps up with fuel consumption

### Production Line Efficiency
- Keep furnaces supplied with both fuel and ingredients
- Monitor furnace input/output flow to prevent stalling
- Ensure proper ingredient supply chain to avoid NO_INGREDIENTS status

### Entity Placement
- Verify target location is clear before placing new entities
- Ensure proper spacing between entities to allow for inserter operation
- Consider future expansion when placing initial structures

### Inventory Management
- Check if items exist in target chest before attempting extraction
- Verify inserter inventory capacity before attempting to insert more items
- Implement checks for inventory space before insertion operations

### Belt System Design
- Consider simplifying belt paths to reduce complexity
- Ensure belt segments are properly connected
- Remove redundant belt sections to optimize resource usage
